frame.name: Volubility
frame.definition:
<def-root>These words describe the size of message that a <fen>Speaker</fen> is judged by a (usually unexpressed) <fen>Judge</fen> to give, either in a specific occasion or <fen>Topic</fen> or in general. As in other communication frames, <fen>Medium</fen> may also be expressed. <ex></ex> <ex>Graham is very shy with most people, but <fex name="Speaker">he</fex> <m>gets</m> <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>chatty</t> <fex name="Company">with Mr. Roberts</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Speaker">Evelyn</fex> <m>was</m> <fex name="Degree">very</fex> <t>voluble</t> <fex name="Topic">on the rights of women</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the person who is characterized as talkative, reticent etc. It is usually the External Argument: <ex><fex name="Spkr">Pat</fex> has been <t>silent</t> on this issue.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Company
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Company</fen> in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> exhibits a certain communicative behavior. In this frame, <fen>Company</fen> occurs in PP Complements headed by <ment>with</ment>: <ex>Kim was <t>reticent</t> <fex name="Company">with me</fex> about her family.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Text
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Text</fen> is rarely expressed because the quantity of information given is the focus of the frame, rather than the information content. Texts can occur as NP objects, but cannot be either direct quotes or complement clauses.
<ex>Kim gave a hesitant, <t>reticent</t> <fex name="Text">account</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is the <fen>Topic</fen> on which much or little information is communicated. <fen>Topic</fen> is far more frequent than Message in this frame. <ex>Kim is very <t>talkative</t> <fex name="Top">about her family and childhood</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to communicate, as in other Communication frames. It is usually a PP Complement headed by <ment>in</ment> or <ment>on</ment>.
<ex>Kim is <t>talkative</t> <fex name="Medium">on the phone</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>Degree to which the <fen>Speaker</fen> withholds or does not withhold information and conversation.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Manner in which the speaker is reticent or voluble.</def-root>

FE.name: Judge
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the judgment denoted by the target.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: herrieschopper.n
lexUnit.definition: die door agressief en lawaaiig gedrag met opzet onenigheid zoekt

lexUnit.name: praatjesmaker.n
lexUnit.definition: die veel praatjes heeft, zich veel inbeeldt
